CatDescriptText: Mr. James A. Brown, 614 Lawson Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?" Answer reads: "In a way, I think that they do, but on the other hand, I don't think that there is enough voting. I think that if there were enough voting and sticking together on the ballot things would be much better."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James A. Brown wearing diamond patterned shirt, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and Regal Shoes and Kays in background
